member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults
member.summary: Specifies identifiers to indicate the return value of a task dialog box.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.None
member.summary: Nothing is returned from the dialog box.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.Ok
member.summary: The dialog box return value is Ok (usually sent from a button labeled Ok).

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.Yes
member.summary: The dialog box return value is Yes (usually sent from a button labeled Yes).

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.No
member.summary: The dialog box return value is No (usually sent from a button labeled No).

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.Cancel
member.summary: The dialog box return value is Cancel (usually sent from a button labeled Cancel). Can also be as a result of clicking the red X in the top right corner.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.Retry
member.summary: The dialog box return value is Retry (usually sent from a button labeled Retry).

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.Close
member.summary: The dialog box return value is Close (usually sent from a button labeled Close),

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.Command
member.summary: The dialog box return value is a custom command (usually sent from a command button).

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults.Custom
member.summary: The dialog box return value is a custom button (usually sent from a custom-defined button).

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult
member.summary: Specifies data for the return values of a task dialog box.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.Empty
member.summary: Represents a result with no data.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.Result
member.summary: Gets the of the TaskDialog.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.VerificationChecked
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the verification checkbox was checked. A null value indicates that the checkbox wasn't shown.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.RadioButtonResult
member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of the radio button that was clicked. A null value indicates that no radio button was clicked.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.CommandButtonResult
member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of the command button that was clicked. A null value indicates that no command button was clicked.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.CustomButtonResult
member.summary: Gets the zero-based index of the custom button that was clicked. A null value indicates that no custom button was clicked.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResult.#ctor(Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogResults,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The simple TaskDialog result.
Wether the verification checkbox was checked.
The radio button result, if any.
The command button result, if any.
The custom button result, if any.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCallback
member.summary: The signature of the callback that recieves notificaitons from a Task Dialog.
member.param: The active dialog. Use this to manipulate various properties of the dialog as it is displayed.
The notification arguments including the type of notification and information for the notification.
The value set on TaskDialog.CallbackData
member.returns: Return value meaning varies depending on the Notification member of args.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons
member.summary: Specifies the standard buttons that are displayed on a task dialog.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.None
member.summary: No common buttons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.OK
member.summary: OK common button. If selected Task Dialog will return DialogResult.OK.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.Yes
member.summary: Yes common button. If selected Task Dialog will return DialogResult.Yes.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.No
member.summary: No common button. If selected Task Dialog will return DialogResult.No.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.Cancel
member.summary: Cancel common button. If selected Task Dialog will return DialogResult.Cancel. If this button is specified, the dialog box will respond to typical cancel actions (Alt-F4 and Escape).

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.Retry
member.summary: Retry common button. If selected Task Dialog will return DialogResult.Retry.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.Close
member.summary: Close common button. If selected Task Dialog will return this value.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.YesNo
member.summary: The message box displays Yes and No buttons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.YesNoCancel
member.summary: The message box displays Yes, No, and Cancel buttons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.OKCancel
member.summary: The message box displays OK and Cancel buttons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogCommonButtons.RetryCancel
member.summary: The message box displays Retry and Cancel buttons.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions
member.summary: Defines configuration options for showing a task dialog.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.Default
member.summary: The default to be used by all new s.
member.remarks: Use this to make application-wide defaults, such as for the caption.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.Owner
member.summary: The owner window of the task dialog box.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.Title
member.summary: Caption of the window.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.MainIcon
member.summary: A large 32x32 icon that signifies the purpose of the dialog, using one of the built-in system icons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.CustomMainIcon
member.summary: A large 32x32 icon that signifies the purpose of the dialog, using a custom Icon resource. If defined will be ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.MainInstruction
member.summary: Principal text.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.Content
member.summary: Supplemental text that expands on the principal text.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.ExpandedInfo
member.summary: Extra text that will be hidden by default.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.ExpandedByDefault
member.summary: Indicates that the expanded info should be displayed when the dialog is initially displayed.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.ExpandToFooter
member.summary: Indicates that the expanded info should be displayed at the bottom of the dialog's footer area instead of immediately after the dialog's content.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.CommonButtons
member.summary: Standard buttons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.RadioButtons
member.summary: Application-defined options for the user.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.CustomButtons
member.summary: Buttons that are not from the set of standard buttons. Use an ampersand to denote an access key.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.CommandButtons
member.summary: Command link buttons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.DefaultButtonIndex
member.summary: Zero-based index of the button to have focus by default.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.VerificationText
member.summary: Text accompanied by a checkbox, typically for user feedback such as Do-not-show-this-dialog-again options.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.VerificationByDefault
member.summary: Indicates that the verification checkbox in the dialog is checked when the dialog is initially displayed.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.FooterIcon
member.summary: A small 16x16 icon that signifies the purpose of the footer text, using one of the built-in system icons.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.CustomFooterIcon
member.summary: A small 16x16 icon that signifies the purpose of the footer text, using a custom Icon resource. If defined will be ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.FooterText
member.summary: Additional footer text.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.AllowDialogCancellation
member.summary: Indicates that the dialog should be able to be closed using Alt-F4, Escape, and the title bar's close button even if no cancel button is specified the CommonButtons.
member.remarks: You'll want to set this to true if you use CustomButtons and have a Cancel-like button in it.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.ShowProgressBar
member.summary: Indicates that a Progress Bar is to be displayed.
member.remarks: You can set the state, whether paused, in error, etc., as well as the range and current value by setting a callback and timer to control the dialog at custom intervals.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.ShowMarqueeProgressBar
member.summary: Indicates that an Marquee Progress Bar is to be displayed.
member.remarks: You can set start and stop the animation by setting a callback and timer to control the dialog at custom intervals.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.Callback
member.summary: A callback that receives messages from the Task Dialog when various events occur.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.CallbackData
member.summary: Reference object that is passed to the callback.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogOptions.EnableCallbackTimer
member.summary: Indicates that the task dialog's callback is to be called approximately every 200 milliseconds.
member.remarks: Enable this in order to do updates on the task dialog periodically, such as for a progress bar, current download speed, or estimated time to complete, etc.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogButtonData
member.summary: Provides data for all task dialog buttons.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogButtonData.ID
member.summary: Gets the button's ID value to return when clicked.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogButtonData.Text
member.summary: Gets the button's text label.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogButtonData.IsDefault
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the button should be the default.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogButtonData.IsCancel
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether or not the button should be a cancel.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogButtonData.Command
member.summary: Gets the button's command.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogButtonData.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification
member.summary: Task Dialog callback notifications.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.Created
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog once the dialog has been created and before it is displayed. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.ButtonClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user selects a button or command link in the task dialog. The button ID corresponding to the button selected will be available in the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. To prevent the Task Dialog from closing, the application must return true, otherwise the Task Dialog will be closed and the button ID returned to via the original application call.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.HyperlinkClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user clicks on a hyperlink in the Task Dialogâs content. The string containing the HREF of the hyperlink will be available in the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. To prevent the TaskDialog from shell executing the hyperlink, the application must return TRUE, otherwise ShellExecute will be called.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.Timer
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog approximately every 200 milliseconds when TaskDialog.CallbackTimer has been set to true. The number of milliseconds since the dialog was created or the notification returned true is available on the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. To reset the tickcount, the application must return true, otherwise the tickcount will continue to increment.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.Destroyed
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when it is destroyed and its window handle no longer valid. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.RadioButtonClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user selects a radio button in the task dialog. The button ID corresponding to the button selected will be available in the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.DialogConstructed
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog once the dialog has been constructed and before it is displayed. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.VerificationClicked
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user checks or unchecks the verification checkbox. The verificationFlagChecked value is available on the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.Help
member.summary: Sent by the Task Dialog when the user presses F1 on the keyboard while the dialog has focus. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotification.ExpandoButtonClicked
member.summary: Sent by the task dialog when the user clicks on the dialog's expando button. The expanded value is available on the TaskDialogNotificationArgs. The value returned by the callback is ignored.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs
member.summary: Arguments passed to the TaskDialog callback.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.notification
member.summary: What the TaskDialog callback is a notification of.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.buttonId
member.summary: The button ID if the notification is about a button. This a DialogResult value or the ButtonID member of a TaskDialogButton set in the TaskDialog.Buttons or TaskDialog.RadioButtons members.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.hyperlink
member.summary: The HREF string of the hyperlink the notification is about.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.timerTickCount
member.summary: The number of milliseconds since the dialog was opened or the last time the callback for a timer notification reset the value by returning true.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.verificationFlagChecked
member.summary: The state of the verification flag when the notification is about the verification flag.

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.expanded
member.summary: The state of the dialog expando when the notification is about the expando.

member.name: P:Macad.Presentation.TaskDialogNotificationArgs.Notification
member.summary: What the TaskDialog callback is a notification of.

member.summary: The HREF string of the hyperlink the notification is about.

member.summary: The state of the verification flag when the notification is about the verification flag.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.TreeView.VirtualizingTreePanel.GetCachedOrEstimatedHeight(Macad.Presentation.TreeView.TreeViewEx,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the size of the container for a given item. The size can come from the container, a lookup, or a guess depending on the virtualization state of the item.
member.returns: The cached or estimated size.
member.remarks: This estimation looks if the given index is cached. If not it returns the maximum height of the cached containers. If no container is cached, returns zero. One case it fails is, if all cached items are bigger than the estimated items. This leads to jumping scrollbars. The effect is not that bad, if many items will be visualized.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.TwoColumnGrid
member.summary: Defines a table that has two columns with any number of rows.
member.remarks:
This panel is designed for use in configuration/settings windows where you typically have a pairs of "Label: SomeControl" organized in rows.
The width of the first column is determined by the widest item that column and the width of the second column is expanded to occupy all remaining space.
Written by: Isak Savo, isak.savo@gmail.com Licensed under the Code Project Open License http://www.codeproject.com/info/cpol10.aspx

member.name: F:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.AutoEnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport
member.summary: When true it will try to enable Horizontal Wheel support on parent windows/popups/context menus automatically so the programmer does not need to call it. Defaults to true.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.EnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.Windows.Window)
member.summary: Enable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the window. This method does not need to be called if AutoEnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport is true. This does not include popups or context menus. If it was already enabled it will do nothing.
member.param: Window to enable support for.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.EnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup)
member.summary: Enable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the popup. This method does not need to be called if AutoEnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport is true. This does not include sub-popups or context menus. If it was already enabled it will do nothing.
member.param: Popup to enable support for.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.EnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu)
member.summary: Enable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the context menu. This method does not need to be called if AutoEnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport is true. This does not include popups or sub-context menus. If it was already enabled it will do nothing.
member.param: Context menu to enable support for.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.EnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Enable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the HWND. This method does not need to be called if AutoEnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport is true. This does not include popups or sub-context menus. If it was already enabled it will do nothing.
member.param: HWND handle to enable support for.
member.returns: True if it was enabled or already enabled, false if it couldn't be enabled.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.DisableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Disable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the HWND. This method does not need to be called in most cases. This does not include popups or sub-context menus. If it was already disabled it will do nothing.
member.param: HWND handle to disable support for.
member.returns: True if it was disabled or already disabled, false if it couldn't be disabled.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.DisableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.Windows.Window)
member.summary: Disable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the window. This method does not need to be called in most cases. This does not include popups or sub-context menus. If it was already disabled it will do nothing.
member.param: Window to disable support for.
member.returns: True if it was disabled or already disabled, false if it couldn't be disabled.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.DisableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.Popup)
member.summary: Disable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the popup. This method does not need to be called in most cases. This does not include popups or sub-context menus. If it was already disabled it will do nothing.
member.param: Popup to disable support for.
member.returns: True if it was disabled or already disabled, false if it couldn't be disabled.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.DisableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport(System.Windows.Controls.ContextMenu)
member.summary: Disable Horizontal Wheel support for all the controls inside the context menu. This method does not need to be called in most cases. This does not include popups or sub-context menus. If it was already disabled it will do nothing.
member.param: Context menu to disable support for.
member.returns: True if it was disabled or already disabled, false if it couldn't be disabled.

member.name: M:Macad.Presentation.MouseHorizontalWheelEnabler.EnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupportForParentOf(System.Windows.UIElement)
member.summary: Enable Horizontal Wheel support for all that control and all controls hosted by the same window/popup/context menu. This method does not need to be called if AutoEnableMouseHorizontalWheelSupport is true. If it was already enabled it will do nothing.
member.param: UI Element to enable support for.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.AppResourceExtension
member.summary: Provides a performant mechanism to retrieve application-level resources by their key.
member.remarks:
This extension is used to resolve resources defined in the application resource dictionary. If the resource is not found, and the target object is not in design mode, an exception is thrown. If in design mode, it falls back to the behavior of to enable preview of brushes.
Using this resource reference combines the performance of a static resource in accordance with a merged resource dictionary, and the flexibility of a dynamic resource when using unmerged files in debug/design build.

member.name: T:Macad.Presentation.BooleanConditionalMultiConverter
member.summary: The BooleanConditionalMultiConverter class is a multi-value converter that selects one of two values based on a boolean condition. It requires three values: the first value must be a boolean, and the second and third values are the options to be selected based on the boolean value. The converter parameter can be set to "UpdateFirst", "UpdateSecond", or "UpdateBoth" to specify which of the two source values should be updated when the target value changes.
